Class Connect4Slot

java.lang.Object
  Connect4Slot

public class Connect4Slot
extends java.lang.Object

A single slot in a Connect 4 board. A slot can be either empty or filled, and it can be filled with either a red token or a yellow token. You should not modify this class, but you will need to use methods within it.

Constructor Summary
Connect4Slot()
          Creates a new Connect4Slot, initially unfilled.
Connect4Slot(Connect4Slot slot)
          Copies the given slot.
 
Method Summary
 void addEmpty()
          If the slot is currently filled, make it empty
 void addRed()
          If the slot is currently empty, adds a red token to it.
 void addYellow()
          If the slot is currently empty, adds a yellow token to it.
 void clear()
          Clears the slot.
 boolean getIsEmpty()
          Checks if the slot is currently empty.
 boolean getIsFilled()
          Checks if the slot is currently filled.
 boolean getIsHighlighted()
          Checks if the slot should be highlighted because it is part of a winning move.
 boolean getIsRed()
          If the slot is filled, checks if the token in the slot is red.
 boolean getIsYellow()
          If the slot is filled, checks if the token in the slot is yellow.
 void highlight()
          Highlights the slot.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

public Connect4Slot()
Creates a new Connect4Slot, initially unfilled. Your agent will not need to use this method.

Copies the given slot. Your agent will not need to use this method.

Parameters:
slot - the slot to copy.

addYellow

public void addYellow()
If the slot is currently empty, adds a yellow token to it. Your agent WILL need to use this method.

clear

public void clear()
Clears the slot. Your agent will not need to use this method.

getIsEmpty

public boolean getIsEmpty()
Checks if the slot is currently empty.

Returns:
true if empty, false if not

getIsFilled

public boolean getIsFilled()
Checks if the slot is currently filled. Your agent WILL need to use this method.

Returns:
true if filled, false if not.

getIsHighlighted

public boolean getIsHighlighted()
Checks if the slot should be highlighted because it is part of a winning move. Your agent will not need to use this method.

Returns:
true if the slot is highlighted, false if not.

getIsRed

public boolean getIsRed()
If the slot is filled, checks if the token in the slot is red. If the slot is not filled, this will still return false; so, this should only be checked after checking getIsFilled(). Your agent WILL need to use this method.

Returns:
true if the token in the slot is red, false if it is yellow.

getIsYellow

public boolean getIsYellow()
If the slot is filled, checks if the token in the slot is yellow. If the slot is not filled, this will still return false; so, this should only be checked after checking getIsFilled(). Your agent WILL need to use this method.

Returns:
true if the token in the slot is yellow, false if it is red.

highlight

public void highlight()
Highlights the slot. Your agent will not need to use this method.
